reviews.review_text: Hands down best service I ve ever had. Upon being seated at least 3 different servers has greeted us. A few more through out the night checked in. Even the owner visits every table to say hello! We couldn t decide what to get as they are so many great options, so we let the server surprise us! The lamb and curry was delicious!

We returned after 16 years and weren t disappointed. The service was impeccable and we appreciated that the owner genuinely  cares about the guest s experience. It s like he has welcomed you into his home with love. The food was deliciously flavorful, and the portions are generously sized. The wine selection was excellent. My son thought the lamp popsicles were perfect.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Charlene Appreciate you taking the time to write about our team. Comment like these make us proud of what we do at Vijs. Vikram

reviews.review_text: Vij s had some of the best Indian food I ve ever tried and I highly recommend it. + Food. We ordered a number of vegetarian dishes that were innovative and delicious. The gravy with jackfruit was splendid. The thali was great. + Service. Wonderful. We had multiple folks checking in on us and truly made us feel welcome. + Location and ambiance. Accessible location and the restaurant was warm, welcoming, and relaxing. We were visiting Vancouver and would definitely visit Vij s again on another trip.

Absolutely amazing! Flavors are just mind blowingly good. The lamb popsicles are the best lamb I have ever had. The spices are all about flavours not just heat. The drinks....wow so tasty and refreshing Also the staff was fantastic!

Nice welcome by host when you enter and for the record reservation yourself first because that s a very busy restaurant  . And if you don t find parking near by then search on Google  . Food is absolutely yummy must try beef and lamb kebab. Chef is really down to earth he meets everyone to make sure everything is perfect and believe me it is top notch from the point you enter and you leave Thank you (Chef)Mr. Vikram Vij for the delicious food and amazing experience And last our tonight host Moe she is so kind and explains perfectly about food. Thanks Moe

Very good service. The food we really enjoyed. Its pricey but you pay for quality. Also met the owner, which was a nice personal touch. Would love to go back. Thanks, Vij and staff, highly recommended.

Vij s gave my family and I a beautiful dining experience. We sat in the rooftop patio, which is full of charming little details, like the bracelets strung onto the tree branches, the rice bag pillowcases, and the bar where you can see your drinks being made. The staff team worked very efficiently to attend to every table. I didn t ever feel that we were left waiting for too long to place an order and our water glasses never ran empty. Everyone was really nice, and our main waiter was very knowledgeable about the whole menu and offered suggestions when we needed them. Vij himself was making the rounds and checked in with us a few times. I tend to ramble describing food in reviews, but nothing I say will really do justice to this. The food is served family-style, meant to be shared. The total before tip for the three of us was about $180. I think this was a competitive price for the experience we had. There were complimentary snacks delivered to our table shortly after we were seated: papri and pakoras. Our waiter mentioned that we could have the kitchen  order for us , which sounded like fun, but I had a few specific dishes I wanted to make sure to try, so we chose our own menu. For appetizers, we ordered the rockfish cakes on coconut curry and chickpeas in star anise date masala, and for mains, cauliflower black chickpea cakes in tomato fenugreek curry and lingcod in green onion coconut curry. The appetizers and mains both came with naan and the mains came with jeera rice. For dessert, we had the mango kulfi and coconut kneer. We all each had a cocktail too (the Vieux Delhi for me, and others had a G&T and a Cambie Sour). I can t pick a favourite dish (or drink) - even though there were dishes I was more drawn to based on my personal favourite flavours, everything was executed perfectly in its own way. The concept is unique from other upscale Indian restaurants - the food is essentially Indian but the experimentation with the flavours reflects the influence of Vancouver s culinary culture. The spice level varies with each dish but is generally pretty moderate; on average, things were between a  mild  and a  medium  level at most Indian restaurants in North America, so I can t see the spice level being too high for anyone unless you have a severe intolerance. For those who like spicier food, the lack of kick is compensated for by the richness of the other spices. I would highly encourage fans of Indian cuisine and/or fine dining to just go and give them a try if you re interested in a new experience for Indian food. I m always inclined to try as many places as possible which means I don t often make return visits to places that are out of my way, but this is a place I would definitely visit again to try more of the menu.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Dana So so so happy and glad you enjoyed our passion of  food and service. Thank you for your kindest words. Our team would be so happy. Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: Extremely well serviced restaurant with amazing Indian food. The food is not your typical Punjabi food, which is really refreshing. Great vegetarian options!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste and thank you Anushree for your kind words . Our team members would love to hear that. Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: I think its the best Indian food Ive had so far in Vancouver. The lamb and the chicken is very delicious. I also trip the eggplant in yogurt in starters and it was delicious too. The gulab jumun was really good but a bit expensive for only 2 of them. The service is also fast and the staff are super kind. Overall I recommend trying this restaurant.

Amazing food, atmosphere, and staff! We are from Seattle and already planning our next trip back to Vancouver and Vijs :) We highly recommend the lamb popsicles, rice pudding, eggplant in yogurt, and portobello mushrooms & red bell pepper curry! Truly you cannot go wrong with any dish though!

The best Indian restaurant I ve been so far! The incense at the doorstep and the hot chai served once you sit down immediately pull you into the world of Indian cuisine. The garam masala portobello mushroom in porcini cream curry was dreamily delicious - rich, cheesy, full of umami from the mushroom - and dipping the naan into the curry   you just couldn t stop having another bite. We also enjoyed the masala dhaba dish which showcased a creative variety of flavors. The lamb popsicles were probably their most famous dish - no regret ordering. Also met Chef Vij himself who kindly walked around and greeted the guests. Hope would come back some day and try other things :)

This was our first time ordering from this restaurant and we got pork tenderloins coconut chicken and lamb Popsicles for takeout. The coconut chicken was very good the chicken was very soft and tender and flavourful and the curry that the pork tenderloins were in was very delicious. my partner and I would say that this is the best Indian food we have ever eaten. Do you lamb Popsicles could have been a bit better but I think it is because we ordered pick up and it got a little cold before we ate the food. The potatoes under the lamb Popsicles were very tasty.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We thank you for taking the time to  write about your experience. Big thanks from us to you!

reviews.review_text: Simply cannot say enough good things about Vijs! Great food is expected, but the wonderful personal service just takes it up to another level. I knew what I wanted, but the others in our party werent sure. They werent even sure how much to order. Our waiter provided gentle guidance that led us to order just enough food for the table, with options that everyone loved. The goat curry and Bengali curry with chicken were standouts. Dont forget the papadum!

Had a fabulous dinner. Service was great - we arrived 30 minutes early for our dinner reservation and we were seated within 5 minutes. Server was great as well, made excellent recommendations and checked in throughout our meal. Food came quickly and everything was delicious. Loved the mix of flavours and left very full. Will definitely be back!

Such amazing food and atmosphere. We sat on the roof patio and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The service was great, and the food was out of this world. Vij even came by the table a couple of times. Such a wonderful person!!! Vegetarian options: Plenty of vegetarian options, and those that were vegan or dairy free were clearly marked. Dietary restrictions: Dairy-free and gluten-free were clearly marked on the menu.

Our family has grown up loving the Lamb Popsicles dish at Vijs when they were at their original location. I wanted to treat mom to our favorite dish so we picked up takeout from Vijs. Since the old days, Vijs now offer the Lamb Popsicles as a small dish as oppose to an entree. We were confused and actually phoned them to clarify. The employee who answered our call advised that since the dish is so popular, people wanted to try other dishes yet have a small portion of the classic which they now offer. Mom was happy when we surprised her with the Lamb Popsicles. There was ample rice and naan included with the meal. The Lamb Popsicles in Fenugreek Cream Curry was as delicious as we remembered. The samosas were fresh and flavorful. Most importantly, mom was happy and full. Get this dish when youre here!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for this review! Means alot to our team that you took the time to write this. We hope you see you again!

reviews.review_text: I really wanted to go to this place, because of the chefss history, and because of the Indian fusion food. And it was even better than I thought! Food is awesome and the price was pretty fair for the quality of the food and the place. I really recommend the place and loved the experience. It is definitely one of my top restaurants in Vancouver. Vegetarian options: They have as always in Vancouver, great options for Vegetarians and vegans Dietary restrictions: They have gluten free, vegetarian and vegan

All the foods was excellent! I ve never tried goat meat so we ordered it (forgot the dish name)it s very tender and that goes well with curry sauce. Especially I loved eggplant menu and lamb popsicles. These foods remind me when I traveled India long time ago. Brings back all the wonderful memories of ethnic foods I ve tried in India. The best indian restaurant in Vancouver.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We are glad to have brought up some cherished memories of your travels and glad we could help make some new ones with us here in Vancouver! Take care and many thanks from our team to you for leaving this wonderful review!

reviews.review_text: Vijs is an experience! [Location and Parking] it was a 7 minute walk from the Skytrain, which wasnt bad at all. Its on a busy bus route as well. Not sure if they have their own lot, but theres plenty of parking in the area, [Accessibility] theres a ramp to the front entrance, and theres a lower level with washrooms that is wheelchair friendly. Some steps to a second level. [Atmosphere] it was busy at 8pm on a Saturday. They play good Indian music at a comfortable level for conversation. The decor is classic, and the mood is set nicely with tea lights. [Service] Top notch service! I really appreciated how mindful and accommodating they were of our food allergy. Everyone working there was very kind and helpful, especially Becca, who served us. [Food] the pork spoon with apple-mint chutney and the lamb Popsicles were super delicious. Everything we ate played with every part of the taste buds. I highly recommend Vijs!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We cant thank you enough for taking the time to write us such a great review of your experience! Big thanks from our team to you! Namaste

reviews.review_text: The Chai Tea when you get seated is really good. The naan, rice, while basic, were great too. Fluffy and chewy naan. The lamb popsicles and the sauce it came in was great. A little pricy tho. The jackfruit appetizer was great too! Really flavorful and unique dash. All in all great meal and service.

The food was excellent. We were greeted warmly from the start, and received complimentary tea and snacks. The  lamb popsicles  were out of this world amazing! The tea was really aromatic and reminded me of my grandmothers tea. Will definitely go here again when I visit Vancouver again. Please go- even if Indian food isn t your favourite!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Leaving this positive review about your experience means a lot to our team!  Many thanks from us to you! Namaste

reviews.review_text: The lure of the lamb popsicles brought me in and they did not disappoint. I hadn t been back in 5 years and the lamb popsicles still tasted just as good as i remembered them. We also had goat curry and it had a nice kick to it. The service was excellent they started us off with a complimentary appetizer and chai which was a nice touch, or as they call it Chai Tea which means tea tea.  And we finished it off with some warm golab jammun which were excellent. If there is one dish you are going to order. Order the lamb popsicles and add a couple more to your order. You will not regret it.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We are very thankful to have guests like yourselves who take the time to leave us such great reviews! We are happy you had a great experience with us. Until next time! Namaste

reviews.review_text: This place was amazing! The staff was super friendly and all of the food was delicious. We had no regrets about anything we ordered, but the Lamb Popsicles and Paneer were a step above the rest. Honestly, the only thing I would do differently if I could would have been to order two servings of the lamb.

Really enjoyed my time spent on their patio! It was a beautiful and super confortable space and it was also very hygienic (covid safety protocols). I loved the fact that we were not stuck with only one server: all of them would come and check on us as needed and all of them were super nice and helpful. Good service is a really big deal for me and I felt really well served there. They knew how to make recommendations on the menu and they all felt like they were in a good mood (this adds so much to my eating-out-experiences that I cant leave it out of the review). Also really enjoyed the fact that their washroom has a cloth towel system which helps our planet so much. The food was incredible! I loved everything I tested and I tasted a couple things. Ive been recommending this restaurant to all my friends ever since Ive been there. (Keep up the good work, guys!)
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We enjoyed having you here!  Thanks for taking note of all the little things we pride ourselves with! Namaste, Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: I thought this place would be good but I didnt expect it to be this good. I dont know if Im being dramatic but I think this was probably in the top 3 of the best foods Ive ever had. Also the service was great! Everyone was super professional and although the restaurant was nearly full, I felt like we were the only ones there based on how well our servers treated us. They also offered us a cup of hot chai as we sat down which was much needed coming in from the -10degC snowy weather outside! The portions here are fantastic and I cannot stress enough how good the food is. I dont even know which of the three dishes that we ordered was my favourite because they were all so good. Also the cocktail list was a great surprise! An extensive list of specialty cocktails that all sounded delicious and the few that we had were delicious. I wish we could have had one of everything on the menu. I cant wait to come back!!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Wow! Our team would like to thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review. We are so happy you thoroughly enjoyed your experience with us. We happily await your return to treat you again. Many thanks to you and yours.

reviews.review_text: Great place to have some amazing food. The price to quality ratio seems reasonable. I really like the atmosphere of the restaurant, its low light and cozy. Overall, the food quality was really good. This is a great place for family, friends, or a date.

From the moment you walk in you feel welcomed. Dinner for two rang in under $150 drinks included. Worth every Penny. They bring around chai and some little appetizers while you re ordering. There is ample staff about to pour your water and clean your table between courses. Everything was absolutely delicious. Highly recommended.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much for taking the time to write such a positive review! Our team welcomes you back next time! Looking forward to it.

reviews.review_text: Great experience and awesome food.  The eggplant with onion rings, the trout and the Lamb lollipop is excellent and recommended.  The staff is wonderful and the owner comes to each table as well.  We will come again when in Vancouver.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much for the visit and kind remarks! Namaste! Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: Vij s Restaurant opened in 1994, and over the past 20+ years, has become one of the most well-known and recognized restaurants not just in Vancouver, but across Canada. Definitely, Vij s is a different Indian restaurant. From the very beginning you ll see the difference everywhere from the staff to the food. It has won various awards by famous food critiques and newspapers with the top one by Mark Bittman, New York Times. The menu is completely different from typical Indian restaurants which makes it more attractive. You have 7 main options & 11 appetizers to choose from that make your job a lot easier. The staff is really nice & king and you feel the happiness among them. Recommendations: Appetizers: Cauliflower, Portobello Mushrooms Mains: Lingcod, Lamb Popsicles, Coconut Curried Chicken, Lamb in Cumin *** You ll definitely experience the difference & fall in love with Dij s. Enjoy!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Wow! thanks very much for this informative review! Out team would be  very happy to welcome you back to enjoy another experience with us. Thank you so much!

reviews.review_text: When visiting Vancouver we totally recommend Vij s. The dishes are made with incredible ingredients, care is given to each sauce, each side, the naan is delicious, and the chai (with or without milk) is perfection. You could have a whole meal of appetizers and nothing would have a repeated flavour. Do yourself a favour and go!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Carolyn So appreciate you taking the time to write about us and giving us your positive review. Looking forward to welcoming you back. Vikram

reviews.review_text: Incredible hospitality and service. Fantastic food, larger portions than a typical Indian restaurant, alas, Vij s is not  typical . The decor, the welcome chai, the appetizer is complimentary, the courses come with rice and naan and the attention to detail and service is top notch. If I lived in Vancouver, I would make Vij s a weekly occurrence. For locals and out of towners, I highly recommend making a reservation and dining here.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for taking the time to write about your experience. We are so glad to you had a great time dining with us. We hope you stop in next trip!

reviews.review_text: Absolutely amazing.  Unlike any other Indian I ve ever had and that s not a bad thing.   Was recommended by a sailboat tour captain when we said we weren t sure where we were going for dinner.  I live in Seattle and whenever I hear someone is going to Vancouver BC I tell them to check out Vijs.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Zac Thanks for such kind words and our team really appreciates it and shall be thrilled to hear about your experience. Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: So if you re a fan of Indian food and you re in Vancouver this is a must stop by. We came early on a Monday and the restaurant was full. We gave our waitress full autonomy over our dinner absolutely spectacular. It was a little bit off the cuff coming to this restaurant but I saw VJ was one of Air Canada chefs. Thanks so much for a wonderful experience!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the highest rating and for sharing your positive experience. We hope to see you again soon!

reviews.review_text: Home style Indian food , made upscale. A lot of what I ate here reminded me of my mothers cooking. The kofta was exceptional; spicy and not a creamy gravy. They gave us free vegan appetizers. The mango chutney and paratha reminded me of snacks my mom would make for me after school. Loved it.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We are so happy we could recreate some delicious nostalgia for you here at Vijs! We hope to welcome you back soon. Namaste.

reviews.review_text: This place has one of the best rooftop patio i have seen in recent years. We went there for family dinner and it turned out to be more of an experience than anything else. A very unique twist to a traditional Indian food. The flavors are incredible, plates are designed so you can order a few and share also great selection of drinks.  There is a wait usually since there is no reservation but well worth it.

One of the best Restaurants you must visit. Staff is so good and courteous. Special thanks to Vikram Vij for Amazing personalized touch and service. He visits each and every tables and even serves. Ask each time about food and Service. Definitely recommend the place for visit. Food

Amazing experience here! Ordered the Portobello Mushroom and Panner curry along with Chicken in creamy Bengali-style curry along with the vegetable pakoras. They also offered complimentary chai, some crackers and pakoras. For dessert, we had the coconut rice pudding. It s hard to explain how great the experience here was and this is definitely the best Indian restaurant in Vancouver. Every single dish including appetizers, mains and the dessert was very carefully prepared with perfectly balanced flavours! The service was also great and the chef himself kept checking up on us which was impressive. Prices were also very reasonable for a fine-dine restaurant of this calibre and I d definitely come back here. Highly recommended and a must try if you re in town. Vegetarian options: Lot of vegetarian options for both appetizers and mains Parking: Free street parking on multiple residential streets nearby

Perfect place to hangout and taste Indian foods. Fine Indian restaurant in Vancouver with exceptional team of server, bar tender and celebrated chef Vij himself. Chef knows the art very well with ingredients, hats off to him and his team.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Gaurav  Thanks so much for the kindest words and appreciate you taking the time to write about us. Shall pass on the accolade to our team members. We all appreciate it. Vikram

reviews.review_text: Its a very unique and super yummy Indian cuisine restaurant. The dishes here are very strong in flavour and taste, at same time, it isnt heavy for stomach. Every dish is like an new experience and surprise. People say this is best Indian restaurant in town. Totally recommended this fabulous restaurant to anyone.

Met the owner Viji and he even patted me on the shoulder cause my dad knew our server from working at a college. I celebrated my aunts 70th birthday there the food was delicious especially the lamb popsicle.

What a beautiful patio at Vijs!   Even on a misty evening, it was warm enough to remove my coat as the patio is heated.  I do not like eating with my coat on.  The protocols in place are implemented and I felt 100% comfortable dining out. I grew up and still live near Main & 49th and though some Indian restaurants are no longer there, I would say by far, the food at Vijs is really the best. The real treat of the evening Chef Vikram Vij was there going from table to table thanking us for supporting local.  We were the first table Chef came by and I noticed him immediately.   I helped my husband take a picture with Chef! We both ordered Thali which you choose 4 items (from appetizers and mains).  So much to choose from!  I chose: rainbow trout, tamarind and yogurt marinated and grilled chicken w/ salad, BC pork tenderloin and one more I cant remember (sorry!).  Thali comes with rice and naan bread. The spices and flavour, oh my goodness, I cant describe it as its so out of this world!  Though I dont like spicy food, some of the sauce as a bit too spicy however, I was able to power through. For dessert, we shared almond rice pudding and it was a nice end to our dinner at Vijs.  We had an amazing time at Vijs. Support local as much as you can!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much for your kind review!!  We really enjoyed hosting you at Vijs for dinner!!  Thanks for supporting local! Namaste, Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: Cozy restaurant with good food and amazing service. Our server brought us complimentary chai & appetizers to munch on while we browsed the menu. We visited on a Saturday night and saw Vij himself, walking around & talking to diners. Amazing Vancouver experience!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Lubna Appreciate you kind words and your positive rating. Vikram

reviews.review_text: One of the best tasting restaurants in North America when it comes to Indian food. I had the best cocktail ever...its the stirred whiskey...try it. The food was amazing. Must try.

Earl was an  amazing server! The food was incredible, I can not recommend the Lamb  Popsicles enough. Must try the delicious mango kulfi dessert. The Nice Guy Chai will surely warm you up. Vegetarian options: Plenty of delicious options Dietary restrictions: Lactose and gluten free options Kid-friendliness: There were many kids and infants in the restaurant during our visit. Everyone was well-behaved. Wheelchair accessibility: Yes, the restaurant had a ramp and was wheelchair accessible .
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Maurizio Thanks for the kind words and appreciate it and shall pass it on to our team and they would be very happy to hear your kind words. Vikram

reviews.review_text: This period of time is most important to support our community and restaurants and we spent last night at an exceptional food display of cuisine, rich flavours and creative use of ingredients at Vijs with the Dine Out Vancouver Event..the Covid-19 requirements were totally met..the staff were exceptional in their explanations of the menu items and delivery of the fresh and totally delicious cuisine..the Gulab Jamun dessert was outstandingly and heavenly tasty!!..so here we are on the roof patio and the space is very welcoming and spacious our goat and lamb dishes met every expectation so did I bring my camera ? I forgot but the images of this superior and top quality food experience is very present.. the aroma and taste was exceptional
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you Michael for your very kind review!  We are working hard to keep the strict standards we set for ourselves so that guests can dine safely!  We appreciate so much that you noticed those details.  Thanks again for the support. Namaste, The Vijs Team

reviews.review_text: Amazing food and drinks, a lot of vegetarian options, jackfruit curry and the appetizer were quite unique and tasty. In general food here is very different from what you get in Indian restaurants in Vancouver area. Special shoutout to the staff, very friendly, manager even sent us a complimentary curry. Loved the vibe! Make sure to reserve a table before you go. Vegetarian options: Lots of vegetarian options.

One of our favourite places to dine at!  Their hospitality and vibe is so warm, with complimentary chai and small bites while you wait for your drinks.  Sometimes Vij himself will go from table to table to say hi and check up on everyone, and perhaps throw in a dad joke or two!  Very nice and charming guy!  In fact, all the staff we ve encountered during all of our visits were lovely and welcoming.  The food is delicious of course!  The quality and flavours are consistently good, and portion size is generous we always leave full and satisfied.  Favourites are the Eggplant & Onion Rings appetizer, the classic Lamb Popsicles, and the Mango Kulfi dessert.  (We miss the crushed pistachio they used to put on the frozen mango dessert.)  I recommend coming here hungry!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Our team extends a warm thank you for taking the time to write this thoughtful review! We are looking forward to your next visit! Best Regards from all of us at Vijs.

reviews.review_text: Amazing food!! So flavourful. We got to meet Vij himself; what a charismatic host! We had such an excellent time. Our server was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable with all the dishes. If you come with a large party, order  family style  and split a bunch of curries so you can taste everything. This place is an absolute must!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Happy to hear you had a great experience! Thank you for taking the time to write this!

reviews.review_text: Food quality is superior. Wonderful flavors and textures. Service is fantastic, and Owner walks the room and checks in on diners. It is a dimly lit large dining room and is VERY noisy. Not a place to hold meaningful conversations. Overall, our family was very happy with the experience.

Went there after 4 years, and hands down its my favorite restaurant. Sorry Indian accent you are better but long distance relationship is killing it  . Food tastes good, servers were great and drinks were good. Dal in saag paneer was delicious, starters were good, the roasted eggplant though it was super small but tasty very smoky. A good experience for a happy time.

If you are seeking authentic Indian cuisine Vijs is fantastic. Vikram is often there moving between tables and engaging his guests while they dine on his amazing menu. Come hungry and if anything its highly recommended you have the lamp popsicle dish. Its the best one!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much for the visit and kind remarks! Namaste! Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: This place is AMAZING! Vikram Vij is such a talented and hard working individual and his restaurant clearly displays that. My family had an amazing time. Staff here are amazing and very welcoming as well as the food is amazing. This is hands down the best Indian fusion food that I have ever had. We will be back!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: We are so pleased to see that you had such a great time with us at Vijs. Big thanks from us to you for this glowing review. Cant wait to have you back!

reviews.review_text: At the insistence of friends, we visited Vij s restaurant yesterday. Our friends indicated it was the best Indian food they ve ever had. In fact, if you Google this (which, obviously you have), you will notice that it is rated as or among the best Indian restaurants in Vancouver. The food is excellent, but is spiced to a North American palette. I call that smart business, but for me, it was a tiny bit disappointing being used to spicy foods. Absolutely come for the food but what makes this restaurant really special is the extraordinary level of service. We were greeted upon our arrival like old friends. The host make sure we were comfortable in a shady spot up on the top floor patio as it was a hot day. Cold water was brought immediately and we were served by several people; the bartender, the server, a member of the kitchen staff (who brought complementary appetizers), a food runner, and yet another server. ALL of these individuals made us feel like we were the most important customers they ve ever had. I was having trouble figuring out which one of them was the owner. But that mystery was soon solved, because it wasn t long before the owner, Mr. Vikram Vij, looking every bit the part of a proud Indian chef, came along to make sure that we were comfortable. After the amazing food arrived, Vikram came back and asked the following question:  how do you like my food?  He didn t say  how s the food  He said, how do you like MY food?  Now that s the kind of personal commitment and ownership that is missing at most of today s dining establishments. There s no person behind the food - that is certainly is not the case here. My only regret is that we live at the other side of the country, meaning that my next visit to Vij s will sadly be sometime in the future rather than my preferred next weekend. Vegetarian options: We enjoyed an amazing vegetarian tray (as well as a spicy chicken curry) which came uniquely served on a platter with complementary naan bread. Every dish was amazing.

The buttery curry plus the tender ribs surprised me in the best way. They probably also have the best naan on earth. Super chewy and delicious. I was so full but still finished the whole thing as I just couldn t stop! The express lunch menu was also super worth the money. The pakoras were the best pakoras I ve had, esp with that magical dressing.

First off, if you want cheap Indian food, this is not the place for you. This is Indian fusion meets fine dining and the price will of course reflect that. We made a reservation (reservations are a relatively new thing, so do make one if you dont want to wait for a while in the lounge) and were seated promptly after about a five min wait outside of the restaurant (it had just opened and it was the middle of dineout Vancouver). As soon as we sat down, we received some complementary pakoras, chaat, and were asked if we wanted tea, which was a great touch. Service throughout the evening was incredibly attentive, prompt, and professional. Even more impressive given with how busy the restaurant became with dineout Vancouver going on. It was our first time at the restaurant and the service was great with recommending what we should try. We were hoping to meet Vikram Vij but it must have been a night he was off. Everything about the restaurant is well thought out and on point. The ambiance is very nice, with candles on each table. Water was served in authentic copper jugs, and tea in metal cups, which my South Asian roots appreciated! If youre South Asian like me, youll appreciate how authentic and flavourful the tea and food will be. We ordered the garam masala mushrooms (amazing!), coconut curried veggies (okay but not bad), and the rainbow trout (also delicious). It was just two of us and we ordered small plates to share, and we were full by the end of the night. We cant wait to make our next trip to enjoy Vijs!

We had the Bengali chicken curry and the lamb cumin curry. Both had a flavour that was out of this world and the meat was so tender. Service was outstanding as well. Came here on a recommendation and it was absolutely a good one.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Wow! we are so happy to see you had such a great 1st experience with us. So happy to hear your kind words about the service and food. We hope your second experience is as great as the first and cant wait to have you back!

reviews.review_text: Easy to give 5 stars. No reservations, so you wait in a lively lounge with included finger food and a great menu of drinks and cocktails. When the table is ready, you are brought to the Marcellus dining room, very retro. Food is spectacular!  Bursting with flavour, complex deep tastes. It is not a cheap place, but great for a special night out. Highly recommended.

Excellent food paralleled only by the excellent service. Went for my sisters birthday and we were treated wonderfully by all the staff, even with a full restaurant. Would recommend the PEI beef dish but you cant go wrong with anything on the menu!!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Theresa Thanks for the kind words.  Appreciate it. Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: I was simply amazed and blown-away by how good this restaurant is. When Vijis opened way back in 1994, it was small and only had 14 tables. With the amazing talent of the chef, it was rated as the best Asian restaurant by the Vancouver magazine. Today, Vijis move to a brand-new and far larger location, with state-of-the-art interior and modern design. We didn t have a reservation (Do make a reservation people this place is crowded!) and we have to wait for around 15 minutes. Unlike most restaurants, this place features a waiting area with tons of sofa and chair, and you could even order some drinks from the bar while waiting. The waitress was really kind and explained the entire menu to us (which is handwritten by the way). Dont be intimidated by the hefty price tags of the dishes, this place offers half-portion for $18 which is perfect for sharing and trying a larger variety of their menu. We ordered the signature lamb popsicles and I got to say it is the best lamb I ve ever tried in my entire life. (I am not even exaggerating) The lamb is tender and flavourful. We spent a total of $122.33 for 3 people.

Fantastic to see older folk as servers. They were so pleasant and made the experience memorable. Food was impeccable, with the standout being the lamb popsicles. The vegetarian dishes didn t shine as much. Chai was so good, perfect sweetness with rich aniseed flavour. Really enjoyed dining there and will return again for a special occasion.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for sharing your positive experience. See you upon your next return!

reviews.review_text: I had a fantastic experience at this place. We went there around 7:30pm Sunday and we were offered to take a seat and to have a drink while we were waiting. We were told that it was going to take half an hour or so to get in. Well, after 15 minutes we decided that lets just find another place and when we went out the door, the main guy just caught us and said that we can have our table. Just right on time. I appreciate that he didnt wanna lose his customers. Finally we decided to stay. The service was excellent. Everything worked super fast and efficiently, the waitress was incredibly attentive and supportive in helping us to choose from the menu. Its pricy for sure. But its a fantastic fine dining experience.

We came here to celebrate our anniversary and had a great experience! We both got the tasting menu dishes (one vegetarian and one with meat). My boyfriend thought the veggie dishes were all quite similar but I thought all of mine were very good. I especially loved the lamb popsicle. The garlic naan was just amazing. Crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside and very flavourful. I do wish that the dishes were more saucy though. We were given so much rice and naan but not enough sauce to dip them in! Service was fabulous and they took really good care of us. Our water glasses were never empty and our dirty dishes were quickly cleared away. I would definitely come back here.

One of the best dining experiences Ive had in a long time. The food was absolutely top notch and worth every dollar, and the drinks were unique and tasty as hell. Our server was welcoming and amazing when we had any questions. I will be back, this is my new fav spot!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you for your kind and positive review!  We appreciated you coming in to enjoy and support us.  We look forward to the next visit! Namaste, Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: We came with a big group for my friends birthday and we got to order a variety of dishes! Loved all the flavours on my palette! Excellent service! Thoroughly impressed.
Wonderful food and easily the best service I ve received at a restaurant! Would highly recommend. Vegetarian options: Great variety of vegetarian options.

We were in the neighborhood with 2 hours of parking... so we thought we might as well hang around a bit longer. We found this restaurant which my partner hasn t been to for a long time and I have never been to, the service is so good, super fast, maybe because they are well staffed, we have at least 5 people waited our table! Besides, the food is amazing! Especially the beef short rib... my partner makes pretty darn good beef short ribs, but this one is beyond that... see photos Downside, needs more lightings in the hallway, couldn t see anything when went to the bathroom.

We stumbled upon this gem Friday night as we were seeing a show at ArtsClub right around the corner. Vij s Rangoli is a fabulous restaurant with a casual but professional vibe. My husband is gluten intolerant so we were very happy to find so many gluten free options. We started with the pakoras with a zesty date and tamarind chutney (a delicious and generous portion) and the Kofta - Pork, Zucchini, Carrot with a spicy sour cream sauce. Their house white is flavourful and pleasant and perfectly complemented our appetizers. We shared the Coconut curry lamb and the Chicken Bengali which came in a delicious  Creamy cumin sauce. Rather than naan bread, gluten free Corn chapatis were provided. We chose a BC Merlot which was recommended and was a perfect choice with the mains. Not being dessert people, we ordered a second Kofta to complete our feast - so yummy!! Many thanks to our servers - Parker & Paul for their personable and professional attention. Highly recommended!
First time trying Indian food, and it s a really good experience for me at this place. Staff is great, food portion is huge, and very flavourful.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you for your positive feedback! Our team truly appreciates it! Namaste, Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: Vij s is completely worth the hype! The food is unlike any Indian food I ve had before, in the best way possible. We started with potato and red pepper samosas and the portobello mushrooms in porcini cream curry. Wow! Both good, but the mushrooms were incredible. For the entrees we had the beef in kalonji cream curry, like the most tender pot roast, but in a deeply spiced sauce. Perfect with the naan and basmati rice served on the side. We also had the cauliflower and black chickpea cakes in a creamy tomato fenugreek sauce. Like amazing veggie meatballs! The wonderful chef and owner Vikram Vij came by the table twice to chat and make sure the food was perfect. The whole staff was great! Highly recommend!

Our journey here started with a recipe from the WSJ  ten years later we finally made the pilgrimage, and it was beyond our expectation. The food, ambiance and staff were excellent. We didn t get to try everything on the menu, but everything we had was top notch. Thanks to Vij and his team!

Every time I have been to Vancouver..this has been a must visit place. Food is amazing..service exceptional. This time we even had a wonderful opportunity to meet the chef and dragon Vikram Vij himself..!! He is an inspiration.. looking forward to vist your restaurant again sir !! Hoping that you will open a branch in Calgary sometime.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much for the visit! Namaste! Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: One of my favorite restaurants in Vancouver. Amazing unique and flavorful food. The lamb popsicles and complementary chai tea are particularly great.

Just a wonderful experience. Super warm staff, extensive drinks list, A+ vegetarian options, etc. The portobello mushrooms with paneer and red peppers and beets dish was outstanding. And the mains come with basmati rice and garlic naan what more could you ask for?
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the glowing review and for taking some time out of your day to write about your positive experience. We cant wait to welcome you back again. Namaste

reviews.review_text: They deserve the reviews for sure. We sat on the outdoor patio. The plates are on the smaller side but the prices reflect that. Service was great, wait time were great. Review for each dish we ordered is below :)
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you for your kind review! Namaste! The Vijs Team

reviews.review_text: Vijs the best Indian food in Vancouver. Having met the chef himself, he is an amazing person and the food at his restaurant is top notch. While we ordered cocktails waiting for our table, the staff kept bringing out complimentary apperizers for everyone waiting in the lounge. We were excited to try all the appetizers. The main entrees were to die for. We got lamb poosicles which was my favorite, chicken dish and paneer and veg koftas. For dessert we had kulfi. Happy tummy after this! They do not take reservations so go early.

The most lovely atmosphere. Hot chai was provided free of charge as soon as we sat down. It had a genuine family feel. A very good vibe. The owner came to say hello to each guest. The food was absolutely amazing. We will definitely be coming back! Thank you!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much Kaylee!  We truly appreciate you visiting and taking the time to share your kind words!

reviews.review_text: Amazing dining experience! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The food was sooo delicious, and the complimentary snacks were great too. I would highly recommend to anyone who loves innovative Indian cuisine!

Vijs definitely lived up to the hype. Their menu has many unique dishes that uses local ingredients prepared with an Indian fusion theme. Desserts were also great in that they took traditional offerings and put their own distinctive twist.

If you wanted authentic home style cooked food, I would recommend this place! Greg, our host, was outstanding with his level of service and explaining our options, and making recommendations. We were vegetarian and found the food less fattening compared to regular Indian food, and the food tasted delicious. Kudos to Vik Vij! I also tried his Gin and the Red Wine. Both were spot on!

Indian restaurant with the most unique menu I have ever seen! For starters we had Kale+jackfruit , peas+lentils and potato+pepper veg samosas which were absolutely delicious. Entre included a selection of  jackfruit/kale/cauliflower/potato curry combo and blackpeas/onion coconut curry both of which did not disappoint ( although we had our reservations about the selection ;) ) they also have masala chai(refill) which was a life saver on the snow day! Thanks @vijsrangoli for showcasing that Indian food is much more than paneer dishes and chana masala with Naan. Amazing and friendly staff too.She offered to give me a to go chai cup for re fill since it was raining. Totally worth the 25 mins bus ride to restaurant . Will definitely recommend if you are in Vancouver.

Authentic Indian food at reasonable price. I love their layout and ceiling light fixtures. Service was superb and fast. I was surprised to see a full restaurant despite the struggling restaurant business. Another indication of good food and management.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you for your kind review! Namaste! The Vijs Team

reviews.review_text: Our first time here- we had a phenomenal experience!! We came in as a group of seven last week and shared a variety of appetizers and entrees. I think we appreciated dinner more as a large group because we got a taste of a lot of dishes! Service was attentive and personable, and they had great recommendations. Never once did I have to ask for a refill, top marks. I highly recommend the Garam masala sauteed portobello mushrooms in porcini cream curry. It was out of this world good!! Our group really enjoyed the lamb popsicle curry as well. Street parking is available out front which is a plus.

Right level of spices and great fusion of Indian food with western cuisines. Great portions, brilliant hospitality. In summary  5-star Indian cuisine experience at reasonable prices. Must visit in Vancouver!

Loved the experience! The food was so luscious. It truly was the best Indian food I have ever had and I have been to many other Indian restaurants! The quality of the food is top class and the servers do an amazing job! Delicious desserts and curries!

Such an amazing restaurant - absolutely loved everything we ordered. This was the first time we have had Indian food that wasnt the same food over and over again. Were visiting from Toronto and will definitely be trying to squeeze in one more visit before we go back.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you for your positive feedback! Our team truly appreciates it! Namaste, Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: excellent service! the food was chefs kiss. great options for all. the chai tea was delicious. highly recommend.

10/10 for food, service and ambiance! The food was phenomenal, and they were able to provide gluten free naan. We had a seat on the patio, and it was heated and cozy, and our servers were incredibly professional and so attentive. Side note: our server clearing the table had the best plate stacking skills Id ever seen, very impressed!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you for your positive feedback! Our team truly appreciates it! Namaste, Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: It was our first time visiting Vijs. Their service was genuine and were following safety protocols for everyone which we were impressed and felt comfortable.  Food was amazing! We got both vegetarian and meat Thali with 8 different menus and enjoyed every single bite of it all! Ambiance was lovely and wish to dine out at their outdoor (or balcony) area next time. Thank you for your great service and food

Note: They do not take reservations! Vij is a wonderful host, he makes you feel like family even if its youre first visit!  The staff are friendly and very accommodating. When attending Vijs plan to have a 2+ hour dining experience, worth every minute! On busy days you will spend about an hour in the lounge where you can order delicious beverages, and snack on complimentary bites before being seated for dinner! **If the wait is too long you can always ask to sit on the patio- but the menu is limited up there! My favorite dish is the Lamp Popsicles, however, you will not be disappointed with whatever you order.

This was the first time we had visited this place although we have been a frequent visitor of My Shanti by Vikram Vij in South Surrey. It was a sudden plan without any prior booking, so we just called to book a table to avoid waiting outside but unfortunately due to a busy Saturday we couldn t find a table inside and had to sit outside on Patio. We were amazed to see Vikram (Owner) himself took quiet a number of rounds to our table asking about our wellness and comfort, my younger one was feeling cold outside, so he pulled out a blanket from his car and gave it to her. It was an amazing gesture from a wonderful Gentleman! Later on when the food started coming on, without bothering to save a prayer, we all ravenously jumped on it like a pack of starving wolves. We were amazed at the quality, the food was absolutely delicious, tasted like a freshly cooked home food without any preservatives. The best part was you didn t feel bloated after eating at an Indian Restaurant. Later on we got to know by Vikram that they don t have a recipe and they cook it fresh for every time. Our 5  rating for the entire team of Vij s and a special Thanks to Vikram for the ultimate Hospitality!!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you so much for your positive review! Our team truly appreciates it! Namaste! The Vijs Team

reviews.review_text: A modern take on Indian food, and a delicious one! Curries taste fresh, unique, and distinct. Must-haves are lamb popsicles, samosa, and paneer. Naan is hot, fresh, chewy, exceptional.

I visited Rangoli, which I understand has now consolidated with Vijs menu. I greatly enjoyed the flavours, the interesting blending of local produce and Indian spices and the ambiance.  Totally worth the money. Recommended!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank-you so much for the positive review, it is really appreciated!  We are so honored you chose us, so happy you had a good time! Namaste! Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: I was going to rate this place 4 stars but the service makes up for what it lacks. The food is good 4 stars, not your typical Indian food it s Vij s creation. Our waiter told us before ordering that portions were family sized, I beg to differ. The naan bread and Jeera rice is complimentary but you have to keep asking for more  the service, presentation, ambiance and attention to details is 5stars. I will return.

We had a wonderful dinner with excellent food, drink and fantastic staff. We really appreciated the many vegan options! Vegetarian options: There were many vegan options! Dietary restrictions: The staff asked about any dietary restrictions and one of our group indicated no-dairy. All staff that came to the table during the evening flagged whether a dish had dairy or not! Fantastic service!
The service was incredible and amazing. Nitesh made sure we had a great time. 100/100 recommend.
Great atmosphere, super friendly service from all staff.  Flavours of all the dishes are amazing.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Your high rating and kind words mean the world to us! Thank you! We hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: Back in 2016 I remember one for my professor Sean talking about his experience at Vij s as he explained us about basics of mouth to mouth marketing ! (he came to know about Vij s through a friend) he described his experience in such an amazing way that it left a mark on me  and I made up my mind that whenever I visit Vancouver I ll go there. Fast forward year 2022 , 6 year later I finally had a chance to visit Vancouver and on day three of my trip me and my friends had made reservation to visit them I made sure a month prior to make a reservation and I was excited for this gastronomic experience even reached there 15 minutes prior to our reservation the hustle bustle the ambience and aromatic smell oh boy I was ready but guess what I pulled up a classic move   showed up a day before our reservation !   ( we were supposed to leave for jasper the next morning and than GTA bound from there ) The restaurant was busy at it was Friday night ! The kind hostess smiled and told me oh honey the reservation is for tomorrow happens to best of us and there dropped my excitement , but I guess she saw how sad I was and asked us to wait ! And got us really good table in like 5 mins THIS..THIS is what s  going to stay with me forever the experience the service along with beautifully prepared delicious food and now I hear anyone going to Vancouver I make sure to tell them that do visit Vij s ! Thank you for the amazing time and food ! Food so good that forgot to take picture
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Wow! Many thanks to you for writing this and sharing your experience. Meaningful experiences like this are why we love what we do. Thanks you again. See you next visit!

reviews.review_text: I can really feel they care dinners so much The food especially the lamb is really good too Recommended dishes Punjabi Goat Curry, Naan
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Namaste Livyan syu Thanks so much for the kind words, our team looks forward to welcoming you again. Vikram Vij

reviews.review_text: One of my top fine dining restaurants in Vancouver that I recommend. Always consistent, VJ is an amazing host, the meats and veggies used are top notch and I have never been disappointed. Vegetarian options: Plenty of Vegetarian options as with most any Indian restaurant. The dietary types are noted on the menu. Dietary restrictions: I am gluten free and if you mention your dietary needs the staff are very attentive and understanding. VJs is a great place and all will feel welcome not matter the dietary needs. Wheelchair accessibility: There is a long ramp to the entrance with atleast half dozen tables available on the lower level for easy access.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: It was so nice to meet you and your guests! Thanks for taking the time to write about your positive experience with us. Come back and see me  and my team anytime. It would be an honour. Namaste

reviews.review_text: Top flight service and wonderful dining experience! We had been to this amazing Indian restaurant at their former location. It was wonderful then and is wonderful now! We had a lovely meal in a VERY busy dining room. The dinner was well made and sophisticated. You definitely need a reservation for this restaurant, but once you get to your table, you are treated with warmth and sincerity.
